intro: Sphaeralcea bakeri, commonly known as Baker's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its globular, spiny seed pods and showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other mallow species. Sphaeralcea bakeri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
